official-title.#text: To require the Secretary of Energy to prepare a report on the impact of thermal insulation on both energy and water use for potable hot water.

attestation-date.#text: Passed the House of Representatives June 23, 2014.

header.#text: Report on energy and water savings potential from thermal insulation

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in consultation with appropriate Federal agencies and relevant stakeholders, shall submit to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources of the Senate

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: a report on the impact of thermal insulation on both energy and water use systems for potable hot and chilled water in Federal buildings, and the return on investment of installing such insulation.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Energy and Commerce of the House of Representatives

text.#text: Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the
an analysis based on the cost of municipal or regional water for delivered water and the avoided cost of new water; and
a summary of energy and water savings, including short term and long term (20 years) projections of such savings.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 4801 EH: To require the Secretary of Energy to prepare a report on the impact of thermal insulation on both energy and water use for potable hot water.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}rights.#text: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
